casebody.data:
UNITED STATES vs. THOMPSON. Wright, for the United States. Goode now, for defendant. Judges Tappan and Anderson, for sustaining the motion— Alexander and Wiley, contra. Judges Tappan and Anderson, refuses to give judgment for want of jurisdiction — Alexander and Wiley, contra.

INFORMATION FOR DISTILLING WITHOUT LICENSE.

When the court are equally divided, no decision can be made.

Verdict for the United States, and motion in arrest of judgment, for that the court have not jurisdiction.

The defendant takes nothing by his motion.

Mr. Wright moves for judgment on the verdict.

Wright takes nothing by his motion.
